text: Ghevra is a census town in North West district in the state of Delhi, India.It is one of the few villages in Delhi which has a metro station. ==Demographics== India census, Ghevra had a population of 5920. Males constitute 59% of the population and females 41%. Ghevra has an average literacy rate of 69%, higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 75%, and female literacy is 61%. In Ghevra, 13% of the population is under six years of age. The main population consists of Gotra Rana. ==References== Category:Cities and towns in North West Delhi district
title: Ghevra
